title: A Game of Thrones: A Song of Ice and Fire
author: George R.R. Martin
review: The most inventive and entertaining fantasy saga of our time—warrants one hell of an introduction. I loved this book!
description: From a master of contemporary fantasy comes the first novel of a landmark series unlike any you’ve ever read before. With A Game of Thrones, George R. R. Martin has launched a genuine masterpiece, bringing together the best the genre has to offer. Mystery, intrigue, romance, and adventure fill the pages of this magnificent saga, the first volume in an epic series sure to delight fantasy fans everywhere

title: HTML for Babes
author: John C Vanden-Heuvel Sr
review: It's never too early to be standards compliant! I taught my little one mark-up in under one hour!
description: It's never too early to be standards compliant! Show your little ones HTML markup code along with letter forms to get them started on the visual patterns and symbols that make up the essential building blocks of the Web. The first in a three-volume set, originally designed by a NYC Web Designer for his baby, this beautiful book is a fun and colorful introduction to the world of web design for babies.

title: A is for Array
author: Brandon J Hansen
review: A is for Array is the ABC book for future programmers. Filled with fun illustrations and simple real-world examples, my children loved seeing my world intertwined with theirs!
description: A is for Array is the ABC book for future programmers. Filled with fun illustrations and simple real-world examples, your children will love seeing your world intertwined with theirs. Throughout the book you will find terms from all throughout the world of programming. From data structures, to function definitions, to design patterns and project management strategies, there is a bit of something for everyone. Happy coding!

title: The Dragon Reborn
author: Robert Jordan
review: The Wheel weaves as the Wheel wills, and we are only the thread of the Pattern. Moiraine
description: The Wheel of Time turns, and Ages come and pass. What was, what will be, and what is, may yet fall under the Shadow.
